item.description:
Yemen (+ Pol Pot)

PHNOM PENH — War Nerd wilting in record heat/drought in Cambodia . . . Khmer Rouge genocide + museum . . . The war in Yemen: when it started (way, way back), who's fighting, and how badly it is going for the Saudis and their proxies . . . bring in the mercenaries! . . . 


Total time: 1:36:12


Direct link to this episode's mp3

item.description:
Originally posted Apr 29, 2016

FSB, the Russian Deep State, Edward Snowden

Guest: Andrei Soldatov, investigative reporter in Moscow


Reposting for open public this great 90-minute interview with fearless Russian investigative reporter Andrei Soldatov on topics ranging from 2006 Lebanon War between Israel & Hezbollah, to rise of FSB Deep State under Putin, the strangulation of Russia's once-wild Internet space, and Edward Snowden's "strange" refusal to meet with Russian journalists . . . Post-interview, War Nerd discusses pustules and current events, reads some Radio War Nerd subscriber comments . . .


Total episode time: 2:28:54


Direct link to this episode's mp3
item.title: Radio War Nerd: Repost Episode #31 Open

item.description:
Urban guerrillas in 70s America


War Nerd in Phnom Penh . . . warning: audio this episode kinda buggy . . . War World Roundup: Ergodan consolidates power, Nagorno-Karabakh front still hot, Western human rights preachers still whoring for Baku oil cash . . . Muqtada al-Sadr's followers take over Green Zone by walking in . . . remembering neocons from NRO to Andrew Sullivan who dismissed Sadr as a nobody . . . Green Zone takeover as future of war . . . The incredible SS Columbia Eagle mutiny in 1970, when leftwing sailors hijacked ship full of US military napalm and forced it to Cambodia . . . US urban guerrillas in the early-mid 1970s, from Weather Underground to SLA, Black Liberation Army to the NWLF . . . 


Direct link to this episode's mp3.
item.title: Radio War Nerd, Episode #32—May 8, 2016

item.description:
Here's a 20-minute preview of our newest Radio War Nerd episode (total length 2:28:54) featuring an excellent 90-minute  interview with Russia's most fearless NatSec investigative reporter, Andrei Soldatov. Subscribe to Radio War Nerd to listen to the entire episode and all previous locked episodes. Depending on your pledge, you can also get our downloadable RSS feed for your podcast app, the Radio War Nerd Newsletter, Show Notes and more...

Join the Radio War Nerd Legion. Before it's too late...

item.description:
The Opium Wars


War Nerd stuck in Bangkok . . . Turkey's genocide-deniers take to NYC's skies . . . Azerbaijan president's insane tweets . . . Israel celebrates soldier who executed wounded Palestinian, reminds of US turning Lt Calley into a hero . . . Egypt sells 2 islands in Gulf of Aqaba to Saudi Arabia . . . The Opium Wars . . . 


Direct link to this episode's mp3
item.title: Radio War Nerd, Episode #30—April 24, 2016

item.description:
Nagorno-Karabakh War: Armenians vs Azerbaijanis (+ oilmoney)

Merkel prosecutes German satirist to please Ergodan . . . War Nerd heading to Cambodia . . . Assassinations from Lincoln to Operation Nemesis . . . Italian friend jailed in Turkey for having pro-Kurdish Facebook posts . . . CIA's "Plan B" to arm the legendary Syrian moderates . . . Russian Sukhois buzzing US destroyer in the Baltics, and gloating at Americans . . . Long history of the Nagorno-Karabakh conflict, Armenia & Azerbaijan . . .


Direct link to this show's mp3.
item.title: Radio War Nerd, Episode #29—April 15, 2016

item.description:
Getting To Know Islamic State Jihadis

Guest: Gunnar Hrafn Jonsson, Iceland Public Radio


Great interview with Icelandic journalist who has spent years now in Dark Web contact with numerous ISIS jihadis. Jonsson is also an early WikiLeaks collaborator who gives background to Iceland prime minister's resignation over Panama Papers leaks . . . 


Direct link to this episode's mp3.
item.title: Radio War Nerd, Episode #28—April 7, 2016

item.description: Radio War Nerd covers the world of wars every week, and it's all thanks to our paying subscribers. Most of our shows are now locked for our subscribers only. So if you're looking for those missing shows, and you want your War Nerd fix on a regular weekly basis from here until the end of time, then subscribe now and join the War Nerd Legion!
item.title: Want To Hear Every War Nerd Episode? Subscribe Now!

item.description:
Palmyra + The War Nerd's history with Human Terrain System

Syrian government forces retake Palmyra from Islamic State . . . The ancient & glorious history of wars and battles in and around Palmyra . . . Why Palmyra matters, why IS took it, and why Palmyra fell . . . The US State Dept squeals . . . Human Terrain System program apparently not dead . . . The War Nerd's long personal history with the brains behind HTS, Mitzy Carlough . . . how interests of tenured academic sleaze aligns with right-wing reactionary power . . . painful memories . . . 


Direct link to this show's mp3
item.title: Radio War Nerd, Episode #27—March 31, 2016
